sn48.19:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
sn48.19:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn48.19:5.1: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.
sn48.19:5.2: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”
sn48.19:5.3: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant develops the faculty of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom that lead to peace and awakening.
sn48.19:5.4: This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”
